intro: Elaphrium fagaroides, commonly known as the fern-leaf elaphrium, is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves that are often aromatic. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Elaphrium fagaroides is known for its medicinal properties, particularly in traditional herbal remedies.
